message: where does express, now and socket.io fit in?
Hi, I'm wondering whether anyone has tried to write a webabb in JS only? Can you use something like node.js and cover all the bases on the server side?
Any insights / experiences appreciated, thanks =)
I built http://prompt.im using node, mongodb, express-js, nowjs & socket.io and it took about 1 day.
(That was with no prior knowledge of how node worked, just history of writing JS on the client side).
great info, thanks
Express is used for the frontend, i.e. routing requests to pages and generating views.

We used nowjs/socket.io to handle the real-time aspect of the app (transporting messages/function calls between the client and the server). I ditched nowjs in a new app and have just used socket.io alone.

@mtrencseni express is sinatra (ruby) like web framework. or flash (http://flask.pocoo.org/) or bottle (http://bottlepy.org/docs/dev/)... and I also recommend mongoose (http://mongoosejs.com/) for mongoDB ODM...

@mtrencseni i have built a multi-page website with pure node.js and pure mongodb the first iteration turned to be a large mess. learned that controllers,models,views had to be named the same as the url so it will be easy to know what to modify.
'mongoose' is good
'connect' is good
'cluster' is ok (you need something like this to utilize multiple cpu cores)
'express' - kind of ok, i try to use it in my new projects, but i don't understand it's automation you don't see.
@simonify I'll proofread it if you write it up =)

@mtrencseni  
cluster: instead of running an http server you do your app into a module that returns a not started http server, then this module is managed,proxied, and initiated multiple times if required https://github.com/LearnBoost/cluster 

https://github.com/senchalabs/connect
connect serves as a middleware  that allows to connect http servers or http request handling functions as Lego one into another
